topics.title: Federal Reserve Interest Rate Decision
topics.description: The Fed's upcoming meeting on interest rates amid mixed economic signals

left.summary: Progressive commentators argue the Fed should prioritize employment over inflation concerns, noting that rate hikes disproportionately impact working-class Americans and small businesses while benefiting large financial institutions.

articles.author: David Pakman
articles.title: Why the Fed Is Failing Workers
articles.description: Analysis of how Federal Reserve policy decisions affect working-class Americans differently than wealthy investors...

articles.author: Kyle Kulinski
articles.title: The Fed's Class War Against Workers
articles.description: Breaking down the real impact of interest rate policy on everyday Americans...

center.summary: Centrist analysts emphasize the Fed's difficult balancing act, acknowledging both inflation risks and growth concerns. They generally support data-driven decisions and warn against politicizing monetary policy.

articles.author: Matt Yglesias
articles.title: The Fed's Impossible Balancing Act
articles.description: Why the Federal Reserve faces no easy choices in the current economic environment...

right.summary: Conservative voices blame previous stimulus spending for current inflation, arguing the Fed waited too long to raise rates. They advocate for tighter monetary policy and reduced government spending.

articles.author: Ben Shapiro
articles.title: Inflation Is a Government-Made Crisis
articles.description: How decades of irresponsible spending created the inflation crisis we face today...

articles.author: Dan Bongino
articles.title: Biden's Fed Is Destroying Your Savings
articles.description: The real story behind inflation and what it means for your wallet...

topics.title: AI Regulation Proposals in Congress
topics.description: New bipartisan bills addressing AI safety, copyright, and workforce impacts

left.summary: Left-leaning commentators focus on worker displacement concerns and corporate accountability. They support strong regulations on AI training data, algorithmic bias audits, and protections for creative workers.

articles.author: Krystal Ball
articles.title: Big Tech's AI Power Grab Must Be Stopped
articles.description: Why Congress needs to act now to protect workers and creators from unregulated AI...

center.summary: Moderate voices advocate for balanced regulation that protects consumers without stifling innovation. They emphasize international competitiveness while supporting transparency requirements and liability frameworks.

articles.author: Destiny
articles.title: The AI Regulation Debate Needs More Nuance
articles.description: Breaking down the competing interests in the AI regulation debate...

articles.author: Coleman Hughes
articles.title: How to Regulate AI Without Killing Innovation
articles.description: A balanced approach to AI governance that protects both consumers and progress...

right.summary: Conservative commentators warn against overregulation that could push AI development overseas. They prefer industry self-regulation and express concern about government censorship through AI content policies.

articles.author: Tim Pool
articles.title: Government AI Regulation Is Really About Censorship
articles.description: Why the push for AI regulation is really about controlling speech...

topics.title: Immigration Policy and Border Security
topics.description: Ongoing debate over border policy following recent congressional negotiations

left.summary: Progressive voices emphasize humanitarian concerns and the economic contributions of immigrants. They criticize enforcement-only approaches and advocate for pathways to citizenship and asylum reform.

articles.author: Hasan Piker
articles.title: The Border Crisis Is a Manufactured Panic
articles.description: Examining the real facts behind the border narrative...

articles.author: Sam Seder
articles.title: Immigration Economics 101
articles.description: What the data actually says about immigration's impact on the economy...

center.summary: Centrist commentators acknowledge the need for both border security and immigration reform. They support bipartisan compromise solutions that address enforcement while creating legal pathways.

articles.author: Josh Barro
articles.title: Why the Border Deal Failed and What Comes Next
articles.description: Analysis of the failed bipartisan border negotiations...

right.summary: Conservative commentators prioritize border security and enforcement, arguing current policies encourage illegal crossings. They advocate for stricter asylum rules, wall construction, and deportation of visa overstays.

articles.author: Steven Crowder
articles.title: The Border Crisis Democrats Don't Want You to See
articles.description: Exposing the reality at the southern border...

articles.author: Matt Walsh
articles.title: Why Open Borders Is National Suicide
articles.description: The case for strong border enforcement and immigration limits...
